attributes.action: ask the BBC to rethink appointing a muslim as the head of religious broadcasting
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Britain is supposed to be a Christian country, with our head of state being head of the (Christian) Church of England, and with the majority of citizen associating themselves more with Christian beliefs than other faiths (even if they do not regularly attend churches).

The BBC, however, has increasing demonstrated an anti-Christian bias, including the provocative and offensive screening of Jerry Springer The Opera, regularly portraying Christians as old fashioned and out of touch (eg Dot Branning in Eastenders), and appointing a Sikh as producer of Songs of Praise.

Whilst Mr Ahmed may be a good broadcaster, surely in a nominally Christian country, we should have religious programming run by a Christian rather than a Muslim. Can you really see Iraq appointing a Christian to run its religious programming?

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
